aboutMe.contentIntro: Hi, I'm Nolan! I'm a software developer living in Hokkaido, Japan. Three years ago, I moved from the USA to Japan to teach English via the JET (Japan Exchange Teaching) Program. One year ago, out of a desire to learn a new, marketable skill I could spearhead a career with, I began learning software development through the Odin Project. Through it I've gained a strong foundation of front-end and back-end development principles, as well as development experience using Rails and React.
aboutMe.contentSkills1: My technical skills include JavaScript, Ruby, Ruby on Rails, HTML, and CSS. I also developed skills in React and TypeScript, which I used to build this website. I'm particularly interested in creating websites and applications which provide users of all abilities a superb experience.
aboutMe.contentSkills2: I have JLPT N2 Certification (January, 2023) and can speak, read, and write Japanese at a Business-level.
aboutMe.contentHobbies: When I'm not coding, you can find me playing basketball, reading about history, or spending time with my wonderful wife.

contactCard.content1: Feel free to reach out for collaborations or questions!

careerCard.content: Currently looking for a full-time position in Japan as a Software Developer, but would certainly be interested in other fields and industries.

card1.title: Borzonibook
card1.description: Create and customize your profile, follow your favorite users, and leave likes and comments on others' posts. Built entirely on Ruby on Rails and launched through Heroku, this project pushed me to understand database relationships on a deeper level as I navigated connecting users, likes, posts, follows, and more.
card1.techStack: Tech Stack: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Hotwire, Stimulus, Tailwind CSS, Heroku

card2.title: Pokeshopper
card2.description: Filter through Pokemon by type, add them to your cart, fill out your order form, and checkout. Pokeshopper uses the PokeAPI to fetch a random batch of Pokemon, and Rails does the remaining heavy lifting by converting them into products you can buy. Lastly, Hotwire and Stimulus were key for dynamically updating the UI.
card2.techStack: Tech Stack: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Hotwire, Stimulus, Tailwind CSS

card3.title: My Portfolio
card3.description: This is my portfolio, styled with a Neobrutalism (a personal favorite) design. I'm most proud of the language toggle feature, which utilizes i18next to switch quickly between English and Japanese. I recently refactored the components to allow me easily add additional languages.
card3.techStack: Tech Stack: JavaScript, React, TypeScript, Vite, Heroku

card4.title: Avramax
card4.description: Avramax, my current project, is an online dueling application for Yugioh. It features a Ruby on Rails API back-end to filter and query through a 13,000 card database, and will use a React front-end to handle all of board-interactions.
card4.techStack: Tech Stack: Ruby on Rails, React, PostgreSQL
